revised_title: Casimir Effect for Self-Interacting Scalar Field: Analytical Methods and Vacuum Energy
tldr: This article investigates the effect of self-interaction on the vacuum energy of a scalar field in flat space-times with boundaries and in the Einstein universe. The authors explore various analytical methods, such as zeta function regularization and cutoff methods, to calculate the vacuum energy-momentum tensor for self-interacting quantum field theories in curved spacetimes.
